## Homework 3

### 4E1


$$y_{i} \sim Normal(\mu, \sigma)$$
$$\mu \sim Normal(0,10)$$
$$\sigma \sim Exponential(1)$$
The first line is the likelihood.

### 4E2

### 4M1

````{r 4M1}

mu <- rnorm(1e4, 0, 10)
sigma <- rexp(1e4, 1)

y <- rnorm(1e4, mu, sigma)

qplot(x=y, geom='density')

````


### 4M2

````{r 4M2}

# flist <- alist(
#  y ~ dnorm(mu, sigma),
#  mu <- dnorm(0, 10),
#  sigma <- dexp(1)
#)

data(Howell1)

d2 <- subset(Howell1, age>=18)


flist <- alist(
  height ~ dnorm(mu, sigma),
  mu <- dnorm(178, 20),
  sigma <- dunif(0, 50)
)

m4.1 <- quap( flist, data=d2 )

precis( m4.1 )

````
